talk.author: did:plc:plz7fkmbzwvjhrt6m36as3zs
talk.utter: I, and many like me, didn't vote Harris because there should have been a Dem primary process.  I still had bad feelings for voting Hillary after what the DNC did to Bernie. The DNC and RNC have demolished demacracy!

talk.author: did:plc:teyzbf6igefc33jiq3yvrevk
talk.utter: In the primary people voted for Biden & Harris. You've done a disservice to your country.

talk.author: did:plc:plz7fkmbzwvjhrt6m36as3zs
talk.utter: Continuing to be ok with being force fed shitty candidates is the disservice.  Some of us have given more to this country than you could ever imagine and we don't deserve to be run over by the corporations that own our supposed representatives.

talk.author: did:plc:plz7fkmbzwvjhrt6m36as3zs
talk.utter: I, and many like me, didn't vote Harris because there should have been a Dem primary process.  I still had bad feelings for voting Hillary after what the DNC did to Bernie. The DNC and RNC have demolished demacracy!

talk.author: did:plc:hliupx4hwhc7evueu4ovq6mo
talk.utter: I get that but Trump is bad news for everyone. I didn't care for Hilary at all and felt neutral about Harris, but I absolutely despise Trump and everything he represents.

talk.author: did:plc:plz7fkmbzwvjhrt6m36as3zs
talk.utter: Yep, didn't vote for Trump or Harris.

talk.author: did:plc:plz7fkmbzwvjhrt6m36as3zs
talk.utter: Yep, didn't vote for Trump or Harris.

talk.author: did:plc:djgilgzlrzrkoxg526iu7tm7
talk.utter: The blood is on your hands then

talk.author: did:plc:plz7fkmbzwvjhrt6m36as3zs
talk.utter: Interesting take.  My motivation is to make this country's policies work for everyone not just the rich and powerful.

talk.author: did:plc:plz7fkmbzwvjhrt6m36as3zs
talk.utter: I, and many like me, didn't vote Harris because there should have been a Dem primary process.  I still had bad feelings for voting Hillary after what the DNC did to Bernie. The DNC and RNC have demolished demacracy!

talk.author: did:plc:bjxwofw7swwec6ejbgwiohz3
talk.utter: Then you are just as responsible for the hell this country will be plunged into as the Republicans. I didn't like how Harris became the nominee either, but I didn't throw a childish tantrum. I did my duty by voting against the traitorous narcissist that is going to truly destroy democracy.

talk.author: did:plc:plz7fkmbzwvjhrt6m36as3zs
talk.utter: I feel I did my civic duty and voted against the duopoly that is killing this country. I've been disappointed with the 2 party system since the 80s and instead of not voting, I'm supporting people that might think independently of the morons that we have been "choosing".

talk.author: did:plc:plz7fkmbzwvjhrt6m36as3zs
talk.utter: I feel I did my civic duty and voted against the duopoly that is killing this country. I've been disappointed with the 2 party system since the 80s and instead of not voting, I'm supporting people that might think independently of the morons that we have been "choosing".

talk.author: did:plc:hliupx4hwhc7evueu4ovq6mo
talk.utter: Kudos for sticking to your principles, though this time specifically I think it was a mistake. I'd love to be free from the two parties and have at least six so we have a nice wide variety of views being represented. Not all of us within our parties agree with each other. Also ranked choice voting.

talk.author: did:plc:plz7fkmbzwvjhrt6m36as3zs
talk.utter: The only politician I've ever donated to is Yang. Open primaries and RCV are the way.
